intro: Strobilanthes anisandra, commonly known as the "Cape York flame flower," is a striking plant native to northern Australia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its unique floral structure consists of two bracts that enclose the actual flowers, giving it a fiery appearance. Strobilanthes anisandra is a short-lived perennial, often flowering only once before dying, making it a rare and sought-after species in botanical gardens.
